author: Tom Olver
title: Arsenal ace Hector Bellerin admits ‘it would be difficult to say no’ to Barcelona
text:
Hector Bellerin is firmly on Barcelona’s radar (Picture: Getty) Arsenal star Hector Bellerin has revealed that he would struggle to reject a move to Barcelona if they made a transfer offer in the summer.
Revealed: What Joe Hart said to Lukas Podolski after thunderbolt for Germany Bellerin has fast become one of Arsene Wenger’s most trusted players across his four seasons with Arsenal’s first-team but the 22-year-old has consistently been linked with a return to the Nou Camp in recent months.
The Spaniard, of course, came through the ranks at Barca before joining the Gunners’ academy in 2011 and he’s given the biggest hint yet that a move may be on the cards at the end of the season.
‘Any player in the world would be very excited to know that Barca are interested, it is very nice to get recognised by Barcelona,’ Bellerin told Spanish radio station Cadena SER.
Arsene Wenger is desperate to keep hold of Hector Bellerin (Picture: Getty) ‘My departure from Barca was a bit bittersweet because of the treatment from some people.
‘I was not treated the way I would have liked to but it is clear that if Barcelona are interested it would be difficult to say no.’
